did.unittitle: National Education Association Web Archives Collection (Version 1)

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: National Education Association of the United States

did.unitdate: Crawled 9 times between 2015 July 6 through November 28, 2018
did.physloc: Records are stored on a web-accessible server.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: To the extent that they own copyright, the National Education Association as donor has licensed their materials to be used for non-commercial research, scholarly, or other educational uses. Copyright in other items in this collection may be held by their respective creators. For activities that the researcher determines fall under fair use as defined under U. S. Copyright Law, no permission to cite or publish is required. For re-use of materials in the collection not created by the donor, researchers are responsible for determining who may hold materials' copyrights, determining if the intended re-use falls under fair use, and obtaining approval from the copyright holder if the intended use does not fall under fair use. Researchers do not need anything further from The George Washington University Special Collections Research Center. Please contact Special Collections if the copyright status of the materials you wish to reuse is unclear. Staff will provide additional information.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Please cite unpublished materials in the following way:
Please provide the title and date of item, catalog number (if applicable it will be found written on the folder), name of the collection, name of the repository, and location of the repository.

Example: James Oglethorpe to the Trustees, 13 January 1876, RG0001 Series 1, Box 4, Folder 3. Records of the Board of Trustees, Special Collections Research Center, Gelman Library, The George Washington University, Washington, D.C.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Chose the appropriate language that matches the level you are describing:
For Collection: Organized into [number] series: [list series titles]
For Series or Subseries: If the series has subseries use the same format as the Collection note to state the titles of the subseries

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: The records of the National Education Association. The collection inventory can be found here: https://library.gwu.edu/scrc/search/finding-aids-by-topic/nea

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of snapshots taken from 20 websites operated by or affiliated with the National Education Association and archived. The websites were selected because they are affiliated with the NEA, either operated by the Association or on behalf of NEA leadership.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: This collection was harvested and archived through Archive-It

did.unitdate: Harvested twelve times between Jul 6, 2015 - Nov 29, 2018
Harvested five times between July 6, 2015 - November 28, 2018

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This website is part of a strategy to improve the health of students, educators, and other members of the school community. Health is defined to include mental health, nutrition, environment, disease prevention, and crisis response.

did.unitdate: Crawled five times between April 11, 2017 and November 28, 2018
Crawled five times between April 11, 2017 and November 28, 2018
Crawled seven times between October 25, 2017 and November 28, 2018
Harvested six times between July 6, 2015 - November 28, 2018
Harvested three times between October 25, 2017 and November 28, 2018
did.abstract: The website of the Asian & Pacific Islander Caucus. The website provides a short statement of purpose, a membership form, and links for activists.

did.unitdate: Crawled three times between October 25, 2017 and November 28, 2018
did.abstract: The website of the NEA's Black Caucus. The Caucus was founded in 1971 to represent African-American staff working in a predominantly white institution. The website provides governance information about the Caucus, including identifying leadership and providing up-to-date bylaws and statements of mission and vision. The site also provides information about upcoming events and available scholarships.

did.unitdate: Crawled three times between October 25, 2017, and November 28, 2018
did.abstract: The website of the NEA's Hispanic Caucus. The website provides governing documents for the Caucus, including a statement of purpose and bylaws. There are also a listing of events held or created by the Caucus, links to resources for members, allies, and activists, and a list of allies.

did.unittitle: NEA Lesbian, Gay, Bisexual, Transgender, Queer+ Caucus
did.unitdate: Harvested three times between October 25, 2017 and November 28, 2018
Harvested seventeen times between Jul 6, 2015 - Nov 28, 2018
Harvested ten times between July 6, 2015 - November 28, 2018

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: NEA Today is the flagship NEA publication. This is the web version of a physical publication that can be found in the collection. The magazine provides information on issues of key significance to the Association, including education policy, educators' working conditions, pedagogy, and social issues. The articles are generally hyper-linked. Many of those links are to websites not operated by the NEA.

did.unitdate: Crawled three times between October 25, 2017 and November 28, 2018
Crawled five times between July 6, 2015 and November 28, 2018
Harvested four times between July 6, 2015 - Nov 28, 2018
did.abstract: The website of the NEA's Teacher Leadership Institute. The Institute's purpose is to recruit, prepare, activate, and support the next generation of teachers to lead a transformed teaching profession. The website provides statements of purpose, benchmarks for professional competencies for teachers, and testimonials from former students.

did.unitdate: Crawled three times between October 25, 2017, and November 28, 2018
did.abstract: The website of the NEA's Teacher Leadership Institute. The Institute's purpose is to recruit, prepare, activate, and support the next generation of teachers to lead a transformed teaching profession. The website provides statements of purpose, benchmarks for professional competencies for teachers, and testimonials from former students.
